channel.title: Homes on Nirbhay Modhe
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Nirbhay Modhe

item.description: About Me I am a PhD student advised by Prof. Dhruv Batra in the School of Interactive Computing within the College of Computing at Georgia Tech. I graduated from IIT Kanpur in 2017 with a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, where I worked with Prof. Piyush Rai. My long term goal is to develop algorithms that are capable of intelligent and flexible decision making. I seek to build artificial agents capable of reasoning under uncertainty, learning efficiently from past decisions and plan long-term.

item.title: News
item.description: [Oct, 2019] I gave a lecture on Reinforcement Learning in the Deep Learning Fall 2019 course. Slides. [July, 2019] Our recent work on unsupervised sub-goal discovery with intrinsic control is available on arXiv here. [2018 - 19] I served as a reviewer for CVPR19, ICLR19 and the TLLLEIB 2018. [June, 2018] Our PyTorch code for VisDial-RL is now live! [May, 2018] I will be interning at SRI International in the Center for Vision Technologies, working on stochastic video prediction for navigation.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching Assistant Georgia Tech, Fall 2019, CS4803 / CS7643: Deep Learning, by Prof. Dhruv Batra Georgia Tech, Fall 2018, CS4803 / CS7643: Deep Learning, by Prof. Dhruv Batra Tutor: Held weekly tutorial classes (read: recitations) along with holding TAing duties for: IIT Kanpur, Spring 2017, ESC101: Fundamentals of Computer Science, by Prof. Rajat Mittal Recorded lecture videos in Hindi (partly mixed with English) jointly with all tutors in order to help students who had difficulty understanding English lectures.
